summary: The federal government made direct payments to individuals totaling $931 billion to help with COVID-19 . However, it was challenging for the IRS and Treasury to get payments to some people. We found that nonfilers (i.e., people who are not required to file tax returns), first-time filers, mixed immigrant status families, and those experiencing homelessness were among those likely to have trouble receiving these payments...
title: Stimulus Checks: Direct Payments to Individuals during the COVID-19 Pandemic
